pageContext.claim: “Well, it happened again. Amy Klobuchar announced that she is running for President, talking proudly of fighting global warming while standing in a virtual blizzard of snow, ice and freezing temperatures. Bad timing. By the end of her speech she looked like a Snowman(woman)!”
pageContext.analysis: Going through an occasional cold snap is not enough evidence to refute global warming. In fact, researchers say more extreme weather of all kinds -- hot or cold -- is associated with climate change. "The NOAA defines climate as the average of weather over at least a 30-year period. So periodic aberrations—like the harsh winter storms ravaging the Southeast and other parts of the country this winter—do not call the science of human-induced global warming into question," according to Scientific American. Despite the cold streak, 2018 was the fourth warmest year on record.
